llm.feedback: Your brief is already concise and hits the main catalysts, risks and watch‑items, but it needs a few tightening edits to meet the 4–6‑sentence, handle‑mapped, action‑oriented standard. 1) Add the canonical handles in the first two sentences: “S&P 500 (spx) fell 0.74 % (B1KYJ1GPU) and Nasdaq (ndx) slid 1.28 % (B1KYJ1GPU)”. 2) Merge the watch‑item list into a single sentence at the end: “Watch the appellate decision, NHTSA updates, and the Fed’s policy path (LJZYDXVL3, 5GZPY1XUE)”. 3) Keep the confidence qualifier but make it a brief range: “confidence is moderate (≈50 %)”. 4) Ensure every sentence ends with a citation ID and that the causal chain is explicitly tied to Tesla’s valuation (e.g., “legal‑risk premium tightening compresses Tesla’s margin, driving a 1‑3 % decline”). 5) Remove any extraneous wording so the brief stays within 5 sentences. These changes will satisfy the handle‑mapping, catalyst window, and actionable‑style requirements.
